problemStatement.plain: The cube root of 2 is irrational. This follows from Mathlib's irrational_nrt_of_notint_nrt theorem by showing 2 is not a perfect cube.
whyMatters: Template for other n-th root proofs

knowledge.progressSummary: Proved ∛2 irrational using irrational_nrt_of_notint_nrt. Key: show 2 is not a perfect cube by bound elimination.
insights: irrational_nrt_of_notint_nrt is simpler than multiplicity argument
Only need: (1) x^n = m, (2) x is not an integer
nlinarith fails on n^3 - rewrite to n*n*n first
Bound elimination: prove 0 < n and n < 2, conclude n = 1, check 1^3 ≠ 2
nextSteps: Apply same pattern to other cube roots

approaches.name: irrational_nrt_of_notint_nrt
approaches.strategy: Show 2 is not a perfect cube by bound elimination
